natlang.rdg.surfacerealizer
Class ReferringExpressionGenerator

java.lang.Object
  natlang.rdg.surfacerealizer.ReferringExpressionGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
LibraryConstants, RDGTransformer
public class ReferringExpressionGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements RDGTransformer, LibraryConstants

This component is responsible for the generation of adequate and varied referring expressions, and is part of the Surface Realizer

Field Summary

 void transform(RSDepTreeNode node)
          Transforms the dependency graph depth first, which can be achieved using the ids of the edges (since the trees have already been ordered)

          Calculates the salience value for the entity and updates the history
 boolean useMoreGeneralConcept(java.lang.String entity, java.lang.String concept)
          Checks whether a more general concept can be used which can be done if the most specific concept has been used in the previous sentence, if this concept has been used for at least two times and if it is not the first reference in the current paragraph
 boolean useName(java.lang.String ent)
          Returns whether the expression should include the name (currently done randomly)

getDistractorSet

public java.util.Vector getDistractorSet(java.lang.String entity,
                                         java.lang.String concept,
                                         int salience)
Get the distractor set; the set of entities which the current entity should be distinguished from This is the set of entities which belong to the same concept and which have a salience value equal to or higher than the salience value of the current entity. Furthermore the entities that have already been mentioned in the current clause can be removed.

Parameters:
entity -
concept -
salience -

getDistinguishingAdjectives

public java.util.Vector getDistinguishingAdjectives(CharacterModel ch,
                                                    java.util.Vector chars)
Get the distinguishing adjectives following the incremental algorithm designed by Dale. The algorithm checks for all properties defined for the current entity whether it rules out at least one of the elements of the disctractor set

Parameters:
ch -
chars -

ruleOutChar

public boolean ruleOutChar(Property prop,
                           CharacterModel ch)
Checks if a property rules out a character, this means that the algorithm checks whether the property is also defined for this character AND whether the value if different from the given value

ch -

getNewAdjectives

public java.util.Vector getNewAdjectives(java.lang.String ent,
                                         java.util.Vector adj)
Retrieves the adjectives used in the same sentence but with later references to the same entity. These adjectives are then moved to the first reference, such that the later reference can be pronominalized

Parameters:
ent -
adj -
